adept.kbapi

Class KBUpdateProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • adept.kbapi.KBUpdateProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IUpdate

    public class KBUpdateProcessor
extends Object
implements IUpdate
    Implementations of the various KB update API methods.

    • Method Detail

      • insertEntity

        public adept.common.KBID insertEntity(adept.common.Entity entity,
                             List<adept.common.EntityMention> mentions,
                             List<adept.common.KBEntity> externalKBIds)

        API to insert Adept Entity into the KB. The method accepts an Adept entity object, a list of mentions that resolve to this entity and a map containing the external KB IDs that this entity resolves to, if any.

        There is a check to see if the entity that is to be inserted already has an ID in the Adept-KB, in which case the operation fails and the user will be asked to reconsider the insert. To enable insert upon consideration, user will need to remove the Adept KB ID from the list of external KB IDs.

        The properties of the entity that get inserted into the triple store are its type, canonical mention identifier (in the SQL metadata DB), and the canonical mention string value. The mention metadata, including token offsets, mention type, source document and source algorithm are stored as part of the metadata database.

        Specified by:
        insertEntity in interface IUpdate
        Parameters:
        entity - the Adept entity object to be inserted.
        mentions - a list of Adept Entitymention objects that have been resolved to the entity being inserted. Every mention is expected to have its entityIdDistribution field populated with at least one entry -- i.e., the current entity. If this is not true, the method fails with a runtime exception. This list may or may not include the canonical mention, in either case we do check separately for it in the Entity object.
        externalKBIDs - a list of KBEntity instances that belong to non-Adept KBs, that the entity being inserted has been known to resolve to. No additional checks are performed here, so the responsibility to ensure correctness of the map is left to the TA-1 algorithm.
        Returns:
        the KB ID corresponding to inserted entity

      • insertEntity

        private adept.common.KBID insertEntity(adept.common.Entity entity,
                             List<adept.common.EntityMention> mentions,
                             List<adept.common.KBEntity> externalKBIds,
                             boolean usePreExistingAdeptKbId)
        overloaded method to distinguish between inserting a fresh entity and reinserting an entity (which can happen when there is a failure in the update method). This is a private method. In other words, an external KB user is NOT allowed to re-insert an existing entity in the Adept KB.

        private void insertEntityMention(String entityUri,

                                 UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                 MalformedURLException,
                                 IOException
        Insert entity mention into SQL metadata DB. Overloaded version that takes 4 arguments. First argument is the entity URI that this mention resolves to. If this is null, the URI is obtained from the entity argument instead. The second and third arguments are details about the entity and mention themselves. The fourth is the SQL connection instance to be used.
        Throws:

      • insertRelation

        public <T extends adept.common.KBID> adept.common.KBID insertRelation(adept.common.DocumentRelation documentRelation,
                                                             Map<Long,T> kbIdsMap,
                                                             List<adept.common.KBRelation> externalKBIds)

        Insert ADEPT DocumentRelation into KB. The method accepts an Adept DocumentRelation object, which can contain references to multiple provenances (instances of the Adept RelationMention object). Each of these provenances has a pointer to a text chunk that serves as its justification, along with information about the argument chunks of the relation. An argument chunk must necessarily align with an entity mention. In the future versions of the KB API, once support for date and number arguments is added, the argument chunks will also be allowed to align with date and number mentions. The entity mention represented by any argument chunk must link to a KB entity that has already been inserted.

        In addition to the DocumentRelation instance, the method also expects information about the mapping from document entities (that the relation argument mentions resolve to) to Adept KB entities, and a map with associated confidences with information on any external KB IDs that this document relation has already been resolved to.

        There is a check to see if the relation that is to be inserted already has an ID in the Adept KB, in which case the operation fails and the user will be asked to reconsider the insert. To enable insert upon consideration, user will need to remove the Adept KB ID from the list of external KB IDs.

        The following preconditions are also checked. The method fails if even one of them is not satisfied.
        (1) The document relation has at least one relation mention provenance entry.
        (2) All argument mentions in the provenances map to a valid argument entity in the document with the highest confidence. That is, the getBestEntityId() call on the entity mention returns the argument entity.
        (3) The roles of the argument mentions agree with the role of the argument entities that they resolve to.
        (4) All argument entities and mentions already exist in the ADEPT KB. An entity mention will be considered identical to an existing entity mention in the KBmetadata store, if and only if all of the following fields match: mention type, mention token offsets, string value, source document, and the KB entity that the mention resolves to. The KB entity on the argument mention is obtained through mention.getBestEntity().getBestKBEntity() -- i.e. 1-best resolution.

        (5) TODO: Check that the entity type of the argument's entity is as expected in ontology.
        (6) TODO: Check that all slots of the relation are filled as is expected in ontology.

        The properties of the relation that are inserted into the triple store are the relation type, the KB level arguments, and argument confidences. The argument confidence value is the one associated with the DocumentRelation.Filler objects. The relation justifications and argument justifications are stored in the metadata store.

        Specified by:
        insertRelation in interface IUpdate
        Parameters:
        documentRelation - the document relation instance to be inserted
        kbIdsMap - map from the document entity IDs of the arguments to the KB entities they map to. Note that we consider the 1-best KB ID.
        externalKbIds - any external KB relations that the document relation is known to resolve to
        Returns:
        the KB ID corresponding to the relation after insertion TODO: add support for date and number arguments.

      • insertRelation

        private <T extends adept.common.KBID> adept.common.KBID insertRelation(adept.common.DocumentRelation documentRelation,
                                                             Map<Long,T> kbIdsMap,
                                                             List<adept.common.KBRelation> externalKbIds,
                                                             boolean usePreExistingAdeptKbId)
        overloaded method to distinguish between inserting a fresh relation and reinserting a relation (can happen when there is a failure in the update method). This is a private method, or in other words, a user of the KB is NOT allowed to reinsert an existing KB relation.

        private void insertRelationMention(adept.common.DocumentRelation documentRelation,
                         adept.common.RelationMention relationMention,

      • insertRelationMention

        private void insertRelationMention(String documentRelationUri,
                         adept.common.DocumentRelation documentRelation,
                         adept.common.RelationMention relationMention,
                         Float confidence,
                         Map<Long,String> argsToEntityMentionMap,
                         Connection sqlConnection)
                            throws SQLException,
                                   UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                   IOException,
                                   MalformedURLException
        Insert relation mention into SQL metadata DB. Overloaded version that takes 6 arguments. First argument is the relation URI that this mention resolves to. If this is null, the URI is obtained from the document relation argument instead. This method performs the mapping of the relation mention type to valid Adept ontology type. Note that if mapping was not correct, there would have been an error thrown during relation triple insertion.
        Throws:
        SQLException
        UnsupportedEncodingException
        IOException
        MalformedURLException

      • updateEntity

        public boolean updateEntity(adept.common.KBID kbId,
                   adept.common.Entity updatedEntity,
                   List<adept.common.EntityMention> mentions,
                   List<adept.common.KBEntity> externalKBIds)

        Modify existing KB entity. The updates propagate to the metadata SQL DB, or in other words the update may also be to a mention or other metadata associated with the Entity.

        If the type associated with the updated entity is different from the original type(s), it gets appended into the triple store. The canonical mention ID and canonical string value get overwritten by the update. Entity mentions and external KB IDs get appended in the metadata DB. Confidences get overwritten.

        Specified by:
        updateEntity in interface IUpdate
        Parameters:
        kbId - the Adept KB ID to be updated
        updatedEntity - the updated Adept entity object
        mentions - Adept entity mention objects that resolve to the updated entity. These will be appended to the already existing mentions of the entity. Every mention is expected to have its entityIdDistribution field populated with at least one entry -- i.e., the current entity. If this is not true, the method fails with a runtime exception.
        externalKBIds - a list of KBEntity instances that belong to non-Adept KBs, that the updated entity being inserted has been known to resolve to.
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating success or failure

      • updateEntityRollback

        private void updateEntityRollback(String entityId,
                        adept.common.Entity updatedEntity,
                        adept.common.Entity oldEntity,
                        List<adept.common.EntityMention> newMentions,
                        List<adept.common.KBEntity> updatedMappings,
                        Connection sqlConnection)
        Method that handles rollback incase of entity update failure.

      • updateRelation

        public <T extends adept.common.KBID> boolean updateRelation(adept.common.KBID kbId,
                                                   adept.common.DocumentRelation updatedRelation,
                                                   Map<Long,T> kbIdsMap,
                                                   List<adept.common.KBRelation> externalKBIds)

        Modify existing KB relation. The updates propagate to the metadata SQL DB, or in other words the update may also be to a mention or other metadata associated with the relation.

        The method does not allow modification of relation type or argument entities. The only changes allowed are appending new relation mentions, argument mentions (for existing arguments) and external KB IDs, and overwriting the relation and argument confidences.

        Similar preconditions are checked as in the case of relation insertion.

        Specified by:
        updateRelation in interface IUpdate
        Parameters:
        kbId - the Adept KB ID to be updated
        updatedRelation - the updated Adept document relation object
        kbIdsMap - map from the document entity IDs of the arguments to the KB entities they map to
        externalKbIds - any external KB relations that the document relation is known to resolve to. These will be updated to the existing external KB IDs.
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating success or failure

      • updateEvent

      • checkRelationPreconditions

        private <T extends adept.common.KBID> Map<Long,String> checkRelationPreconditions(adept.common.DocumentRelation documentRelation,
                                                                        Map<Long,T> kbIdsMap)
                                             throws SQLException
        Check relation preconditions on insert or update. The following are checked:
        (1) The document relation has at least one relation mention provenance entry.
        (2) All argument mentions in the provenances map to a valid entity in the document.
        (3) The roles of the argument mentions agree with the role of the argument entity that they resolve to.
        (4) All argument entities already exist in the ADEPT KB.
        (5) TODO: Check that the entity type of the argument's entity is as expected in ontology.
        (6) TODO: Check that all slots of the relation are filled as is expected in ontology.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • addMapToExternalKBIds

        private <T extends adept.common.KBID> List<T> addMapToExternalKBIds(adept.common.KBID adeptKbId,
                                                          List<T> externalKBIds,
                                                          Connection sqlConnection)
                                                         throws SQLException

        add map from Adept KB ID to external KB Ids.

        Note that an external KB ID map to one and only one Adept KB ID. As a result, if you attempt to map an already seen external KB entity to a new Adept Entity, this method will fail.

        On the other hand, an Adept KB entity is allowed to map to more than one external KB entity.

        Throws:
        SQLException

      • getRelationConfidence

        private float getRelationConfidence(String kbUri)
        Gets the overall confidence of the KB relation from the triple store.
